action.text: Referred to the House Committee on International Relations.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Africa.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Committee Agreed to Seek Consideration Under Suspension of the Rules, by Voice Vote.

action.text: Mr. Royce moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 2/26/1998--Introduced. Commends: (1) the people of Botswana for their commitment to democracy; and (2) Sir Ketumile Masire for his distinguished service to his country and the cause of democracy in Africa. Calls on: (1) President Masire's successor to pursue the course set by him by maintaining a democratic Botswana; and (2) the Government of Botswana to continue playing a positive role in African and world affairs. Encourages the Government of Botswana to continue promoting peace, democracy, respect for human rights, and economic reform in Africa.
